name: Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week with my teenage son and it was in a great location, only 5 mins from Madison Square Garden and 10 mins from Times Square.
reviews.title: Cheap and cosy...

reviews.text: It's a fairly small hotel (although it's over 19 floors) and is currently going under renovation. This was a bit of a pain at times as the workmen on the floors being refurbished were frequently using the elevators (or calling them and then not using them!) which was a bit of an irritation to everyone! Generally, the elevators were a pain as they're quite slow and are also used by all other staff, so we were sometimes waiting 5-6 mins for them to arrive.
reviews.title: I would come back if no better options were available

reviews.text: All the staff were very helpful and had a fantastic knowledge of the area, hence being able to make great recommendations for places to eat, go etc...
reviews.title: Quiet location with ease to subway and MSG

reviews.text: There's a good complimentary breakfast in the mornings; nothing amazing (2 hot choices, cereal, bagels, toast, waffles fresh fruit, muffins etc) as well as free WI-FI and free printing if you need it.
reviews.title: Great Find in NYC!
Best Staff Ever
reviews.text: The hotel had just begun renovations. I understand why the renovations are needed. The hotel just wasn't quite up to snuff with other Hampton Inns. The cleanliness was just adequate. There was some mold in the shower, and the hairdryer had a think layer of dust on the cord.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hampton Inn doesn't look much from the out side but the rooms are big enough for what you need them for, the staff are very welcoming and the bed was super comfortable. As with most hotels in new york there is some noise at night so if you are a light sleeper take some ear plugs. The location of this Hampton Inn is excellent just a few blocks from empire state building, times square and madison square garden. John on the front desk was really helpful and told us everything we needed to know about how to get to places and the best route, he also suggested we went Planet Hollywood for NYE which was probably one of the best suggestions as we were right in the middle of times square.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Recently stayed for four nights at this charming hotel just a stone"s throw from Penn Station and thoroughly enjoyed everything about this convenient hotel. The entire staff was always smiling and helpful and the buffet breakfast was yummy as well as the hot chocolate in the afternoon at the coffee bar in the lobby. Internet service and a lovely Christmas tree in the lobby topped off this delightful experience to see New York at the holidays. Lovely hotel linens and a sparkling clean room were also a plus...can't wait to come back again!!
reviews.title: cozy, convenient, and great amenities

reviews.text: The manager and front desk employees made our trip perfect. They always had smile on their face and were eager to help in any way necessary. The rooms were very clean and the maids came in every day to bring fresh towels and make the beds. We never had to ask for linens. We definitely appreciated the complimentary breakfasts- waffles, omelette, sausage, yogurt, fresh fruit, muffins cereal etc and the constant supply of hot coffee/hot chocolate. The hotel is very close to Penn Station and walking distance to Times Square. The beds were comfortable and sleeping was easy because you did not hear the outside activity. We will definitely stay there again
reviews.title: EXCELLENT STAFF, SERVICE AND LOCATION

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time staying at the hotel. The staff was super nice and very helpful. The location was great. We walked to times square, saw the lion king, the tree and then walked back. Our room was small (most rooms in NYC are small) but everything was clean and efficient. We fit our family of four and wer comfortable. The free breakfast was hot and very good. Be advised breakfast is from 6-10 and they end exactly at 10. Some people came at 10:02 and they were out of luck. Also the parking garage is about a block away. This is a great value.
reviews.title: Great location, great service, wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend like most of the other reviews. Great location. We came in to NYC at Penn Station and only a block away. Subway and taxis at both corners. Very good breakfast. Wifi in room. Street front room a little noisy but its ok to us to hear city noise. Room and bath size adequate.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: We were here for one night the weekend of NYC marathon. We wondered why it was so hard to book a room in the city that weekend! We were in town to see the Radio City Christmas Show for the first time. We know our way around NYC pretty well, so the location was fine. We checked for bed bugs and the room was clean. Small hallways and rooms, but decent location and friendly staff!
reviews.title: Small rooms, but very friendly staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 4 weeks of travelling it ws great to stay in homely hotel. Could walk everywhere.
reviews.title: Great service, great location, excellent breakfast, all day coffee and free internet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great staff, will assist you with any query and arrange tickets for any event you want. Rooms small but clean. Breakfast- plenty to eat. The location of this place is great. The reception staff is the best. Very good value for money.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My spouse and I found this hotel to be very clean (no sign of the notorious bedbug). We arrived too early to check in but were able to have our bags held so we could go to lunch. The desk clerk recommended a nearby Irish pub, which we tried and found to be very good. We even got 15% off our check for mentioning that we were staying at the Hampton Inn! The hotel is within two blocks of Penn Station/Madison Square Garden and also within easy walking distance of Times Square, Macys, and lots of other shopping and restaurants. The subway is located at Penn Station as well for easy access to downtown and South Street Seaport. Continental breakfast was more than adequate. Plenty of seating, even a small outside patio which we couldn't use because it was raining. While the room was small, this is pretty standard for NYC hotels. Beds were very comfortable for us. Bathroom very clean. We asked for a room on an upper floor, towards the back for quietness. Had a fabulous view as well. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.text: I was traveling to the city for meetings and was concerned about the number of quality hotels infested with bedbugs. I stayed at other Hampton Inn's in NYC, but this was the most centrally located. Tee hotel is small but nice, the front desk attendent was trhe nicest guy I have met in the hotled industry. Lower rooms have a bit of street noise, but breakfast buffet was great, and overall a SUPER hotel for convenience and cost.
reviews.title: Very Nice hotel - NO BEDBUGS!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was undergoing some upgrades/construction, but we were not bothered except at check-in (over the noise of a jack hammer) and because the breakfast room was not available.
reviews.title: Nice stay.

reviews.text: Room was very clean and typical for NYC hotels - 17' x 12' plus a small, shower only bathroom. 1 king sized bed, 1 night stand, 1 small desk, and one wardrobe plus a wall mounted tv. Breakfast in a box was good and the A/C - heating uint worked okay. Bed was very comfy!
reviews.title: Free breakfast, great staff, good location, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very convenient to Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, and only a short walk to Times Square. We cabbed to Battery park to enjoy Ellis Island for about $15 including tip. Location was very convenient to our bus from DC (2 blocks). We'll be back!
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights with some girlfriends for a vacation. The staff was very kind and friendly. Breakfast was great and saved us money in a very expensive city. There was cereal, muffins, juice, toast, yogurt, waffles, eggs, etc. The location is near a subway and the front desk hands out subway maps. The rooms was clean and neat but small, which is the norm for NY. We fit 3 people tightly, but if you are trying to sleep 4 people in one room, you may consider getting another room. The hotel shut the water off for 8 hours one day, from 9am-5pm. They are doing renovations so this type of thing is expected and we were out and about the whole time anyway. The front desk was great about calling cabs/cars so that was convenient. The hotel is very close to Times Square, but we preferred the shopping in SoHo, a short ride away. Less crowded, cheaper and more variety of stores.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel - cant complain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. I will start of by saying this was great value for money. But I will also share some negatives.
reviews.title: Excellent location, very clean & modern

aka: Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden Hotel New York City
description: Situated just one block from Madison Square Garden, this hotel provides a great location for travelers looking to be walking distance to some of Manhattan’s top attractions. Catch concerts and games at MSG or walk to The Fashion Institute of Technology and see the latest fashions in the Garment District. Guests can walk to Penn Station which serves many of the city’s major subway lines and be anywhere in the city within minutes including top destinations like Times Square, Central Park and Broadway theatres.Guests will enjoy complimentary breakfast, high speed internet access, a modern fitness center and our well-equipped business center. After you’ve spent the day taking in the sights and sounds of the city, enjoy a peaceful night’s sleep in a comfortable Hampton bed®.
